variables.label: Kibana version
variables.description: It's highly recommended that you don't use the latest tag but instead the major version you need. See https://hub.docker.com/_/kibana for a list of versions.

variables.label: Default App id
variables.description: The default app that is loaded when you visit Kibana. Defaults to home

variables.label: ELASTICSEARCH_HOSTS
variables.description: URL of the elasticsearch hosts to use. Please include the http or https in the urls. eg. http://srv-captain--elastic:9200

variables.label: SERVER_PUBLICBASEURL
variables.description: The public URL of the Kibana app. Make sure to change this if you force HTTPS-only!

instructions.end:
That's it! If you get a 502 it might mean that kibana cannot find your elasticsearch instance. Please recheck your configs.
Ensure basic auth is enabled so your data is not publicly available.
instructions.start: Provide the ELASTICSEARCH_HOSTS so that kibana can find your elasticsearch instance. be sure to include the http:// protocol in the url. Note that Kibana does not have persistent volumes as all data is stored in the elasticsearch instance itself.

description: Kibana is a free and open user interface that lets you visualize your Elasticsearch data and navigate the Elastic Stack.
